description:
Computes the inverse hyperbolic tangent of `x`. It is the inverse function of the hyperbolic tangent so that *`artanh(tanh(x)) = x`*.

The no-data value `null` is passed through and therefore gets propagated. `NaN` is returned for values outside of the allowed range. The computations follow [IEEE Standard 754](https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/8766229) whenever the processing environment supports it. Therefore, `x` = 1 results in +infinity and `x` = 0 results in -infinity. Otherwise, an exception is thrown.

returns.description: The computed hyperbolic angle in radians.

links.title: Inverse hyperbolic tangent explained by Wolfram MathWorld
